P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.title: ElectricalDemandFactorValue.MaxRange Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.desc:
The maximum range for this demand factor value.  For example, objects 1 to 3 can have 100% demand factor.
   In the example above, the maximum range will be 3.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.title: ElectricalEquipment.DistributionSystem Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.desc: get or set the Distribution System for the Electrical Equipment.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.remarks: This property returns a Distribution System which is assigned to the Electrical Equipment. If there are no Distribution System assigned to this Electrical Equipment, this property will be .

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.title: ElectricalSystem.SelectPanel Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.desc: Set the panel for the Electrical System.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.remarks: If successful, the panel will be set for the system. Otherwise the exception will be thrown. This method will only function with the Autodesk Revit MEP application.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.WireSet.I.title: WireSet.IsEmpty Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.WireSet.I.desc: Test to see if the set is empty.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.WireSet.I.remarks: If the set is empty then True will be returned, otherwise False.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Correctio.title: CorrectionFactorSet.ReverseIterator Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Correctio.desc: Retrieve a backward moving iterator to the set.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.remarks: Use the HasCircuitsWithoutElectricalLoadAreas to check whether there are empty plan circuits in which there are no electrical load areas, if there are empty plan circuits, this API will create electrical load areas on each of them, otherwise, it will create nothing. In most cases, the electrical load areas will be created, updated and deleted automatically, but in some cases, there are some empty plan circuits and need to create electrical load areas on each of them.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Wire.SetV.title: Wire.SetVertex Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Wire.SetV.desc:
Sets the position of a given vertex.
   If the vertex is start or end point, and the wire connects to electrical device, the wire end offset will be set according to the given vertex.
   If the vertex is start or end point, and the wire connects to other wire, user can't set the vertex and exception will be thrown.
   If the vertex is start or end point, and the wire connects to nothing, the vertex will be set as the given vertex.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.desc:
This class represents values used by a particular demand factor definition.  Each instance
   corresponds to a row in a table of values.  These values are part of the ElectricalDemandFactorDefinition
   class.

props.d:
The demand factor for this demand factor value.  For example, objects 1 to 3 can have 100% demand factor.
   In the example above, the demand factor will be 1.0.
Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.

The maximum range for this demand factor value.  For example, objects 1 to 3 can have 100% demand factor.
   In the example above, the maximum range will be 3.

The minimum range for this demand factor value.  For example, objects 1 to 3 can have 100% demand factor.
   In the example above, the minimum range will be 1.

   If the area based load hasn't an upstream node, it can't disconnect from the upstream node.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.VoltageTy.title: VoltageType Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.VoltageTy.desc:
Represents electrical voltage type. An electrical voltage type define a range of voltages,
and circuits can be created between components with rated voltages that do not precisely match the voltage definition value.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.VoltageTy.remarks: Actual, minimum and maximum value of voltage type can retrieved through properties, but only can be modified through SetVoltageValue method. All the unit of voltage properties in this class is volt.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.AreaBased.desc:
Verifies that the area based load can connect to the upstream electrical analytical node.
   If the area based load already has an upstream node or the upstream node is full of downstream nodes, the area based load can't connect to the upstream node.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.AreaBased.remarks: If the area based load supplies from Node A, Node A is the upstream node of the area based load, and the area based load is the downstream node of node A.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.title: ElectricalSetting.AddWireType Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.desc: Add a new wire type to project.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.sig:
[ObsoleteAttribute("
                  AddWireType is deprecated in Revit 2026 and will be removed in a future version of Revit. Please use WireType.Duplicate() instead.
                  WireMaterialType object can no longer set to the WireType, use property WireType.WireMaterial instead.
                  TemperatureRatingType object can no longer set to the WireType, use property WireType.TemperatureRating instead.
                  InsulationType object can no longer set to the WireType, use property WireType.Insulation instead.
                  MaxSize object can no longer set to the WireType, use property WireType.MaxSize instead.
               ")]
public WireType AddWireType(
	string name,
	WireMaterialType materialType,
	TemperatureRatingType temperatureRating,
	InsulationType insulation,
	WireSize maxSize,
	double neutralMultiplier,
	bool neutralRequired,
	NeutralMode neutralMode,
	WireConduitType conduit
)
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Electrica.remarks: Parameter of temperatureRating should be retrieved from parameter of materialType, and parameters such as insulation and maxSize should be retrieved from temperatureRating. otherwise, this add operation is most likely to fail.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Temperatu.title: TemperatureRatingTypeSetIterator.Reset Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Temperatu.desc: Bring the iterator back to the start of the set.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Temperatu.remarks: The Reset method will return the iterator back to the start of the set in line with the definition of IEnumerator. Note that you must call MoveNext before the first item can be accessed via the Current property.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Analytica.title: AnalyticalPowerDistributableNodeData.DistributionSystem Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Analytica.desc: The distribution system of the power distributable node.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Analytica.remarks: In the case of a transformer, it's crucial that the number of phases in the secondary distribution system matches that of the primary distribution system. If the number of phases in the primary system is set to be different from that of the secondary distribution system, it will result in a 'PrimaryNumOfPhasesNotEqualWithSecondary' error. If you anticipate this discrepancy, you can avoid the error by first setting the secondary distribution system to InvalidElementId, and then setting the primary distribution system.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Analytica.remarks: If node B supplies from node A, node B is the downstream node of node A, and node A is the upstream node of node B. Usually one node may have many downstream nodes, but TransferSwitch can only have one downstream node.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Analytica.title: AnalyticalTransformerData.SecondaryDistributionSystem Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Analytica.desc: The secondary distribution system of the analytical transformer.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Analytica.remarks: In the case of a transformer, it's crucial that the number of phases in the secondary distribution system matches that of the primary distribution system. If the number of phases in the secondary system is set to be different from that of the primary distribution system, it will result in a 'SecondaryNumOfPhasesNotEqualWithPrimary' error. If you anticipate this discrepancy, you can avoid the error by first setting the secondary distribution system to InvalidElementId, and then setting the primary distribution system.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.CableTray.title: CableTrayRun Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.CableTray.desc: This class represents a cable tray run in Autodesk Revit.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.CableTray.remarks: This class is mainly for calculating length of a cable tray run. A cable tray run contains connected straight cable tray segments and bends between the straight segments with same type and size.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Temperatu.title: TemperatureRatingType Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Temperatu.desc: Represents temperature rating type definition information.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Temperatu.sig:
[ObsoleteAttribute("TemperatureRatingType is deprecated in Revit 2026 and will be removed in a future version of Revit. Please use TemperatureRating instead. TemperatureRatings will be created by TemperatureRatingTypes properly during document upgrade.")]
public class TemperatureRatingType : ElementType
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Electrical.Temperatu.remarks: Temperature rating type is defined based on corresponding wire material type. It includes type information such as wire size, insulation type, correction factor, etc. Only the temperature rating types which are retrieved from WireMaterialType can work well, so don't retrieve it from Revit document directly.
